Context:
George Brown College offers a blend of theory and hands-on experience with a focus on real-world learning. Students have opportunities to work alongside industry professionals in applied research and field education opportunities. The college prioritizes industry partnerships to provide students with the latest trends and tech in their fields. There are experiential learning opportunities in all career-focused programs, excluding upgrading and preparatory programs. Faculty members have industry experience and share real-world knowledge. Students can gain hands-on experience working alongside industry professionals to develop and test new products. The college has an entrepreneurship hub called startGBC to help students start their own businesses. The Program Finder helps students find the right pathway for post-secondary education, career shifts, or postgraduate studies. The campus includes facilities like The Chefs' House and WAVE Clinics that simulate real-world work environments.
